story:
The SMART Series is Here...

By focusing on style, handling and lowering our carbon footprint our team has assembled the first futuristic motorcycle anchored to its past.

We are very excited to share our labor of love with you, the FLY FREE SMART series.

We offer PURE LED lighting on all models.


Serious Head-Turners

We are starting with 3 amazing electric motorcycles.
The new SMART: DESERT, OLD – STYLE & CLASSIC

 

A whole new way of getting around. With a powerful frame, customizable tank and seat colors, you'll definitely be the talk of the town. The FLY FREE SMART series is so much more than a regular motorcycle.

The FLY FREE SMART Desert.


The FLY FREE SMART OLD-STYLE.

The FLY FREE SMART Classic.

 

 

Open Road Freedom

 

Standard Features


You can double your range with an extra battery order, each motorcycle holds 2!


Feature Location

 

 


Meet the Team

Dhiego & Isac

Friends Dhiego W. Bitencourt and Isac Goulart spawned the idea for FLY FREE in 2016 sharing a passion for classic motorcycles and new technology. Their goal was to produce an electric motorcycle that would look amazing, be fun to ride and would inspire a new generation of riders. Merging the classic 1950s aesthetics with today's most advanced technologies became their passion as they prototyped their way to success with the FLY FREE SMART series. Dhiego's business sense complemented Isac's sharp eye for design, and FLY FREE was born.

 

 

From Real Riders to Real Makers

Isac is a young and creative professional who loves off-road motorcycles and surfing. He met Dhiego, a young entrepreneur who had the same passion for the outdoors and the idea to partner on FLY FREE was born. The concept was to build an electric motorcycle lifestyle brand, based on the freedom that riders in the 1950s embraced. They chose the classic decoder models as their original inspiration.

They birthed the first model: The SMART DESERT, after many prototypes and labored iterations.

They then chose to produce 3 amazing models, using the same proven frame, mechanics and battery - knowing so much more could be done. Plus, this would give customers some amazing choices.

 

Merging the Past and Present

Leveraging proven technologies with a state-of-the-art electric drive train, we could make a motorcycle that was easily maintained and could be driven for years to come, without the need for fossil fuels and all of the complexities and environmental burdens that come with it.

From Prototyping to Motorcycling

The original prototypes were all hand-made, cut and welded until they evolved into a powerful frame that accommodated the best riding dynamics. By strategically placing the battery in a key position, we achieved a planted feel while driving in straight lines and making exciting turns.


A New Generation of Electric Riders



We can put the FLY FREE SMART series into full production with your help, and get these fully styled electric motorcycles into your hands, while developing a new generation of riders who can use a cleaner, simpler and more convenient mode of transportation for decades to come.
 

THE SMART DESERT


Go places most motorcycles can't. Freedom, exploration, and independence are staples of the original Scrambler style that made it such a huge hit historically. We've drawn from this ethos to give you the FLY FREE DESERT. From the identifying crossbeam on the handlebars to the sculpted tank, minimal feel, and sleek seat - the FLY FREE DESERT delivers on comfort plus utility and will take you places you have never been before. Coupled with our optional Surf/Snow & Skate supports - your modes of transportation and fun will never be limited.
 
We've injected ample research and development into this design, from mainstream media to real motorcycle culture, and it shows. We used the Triumph Bonneville's Scrambler "Desert Sled" as our inspiration. In 1963, this motorcycle was featured as a desert racer, from the iconic 1971 film "On Any Sunday". If you love motorcycles, we recommend watching this nostalgic film.




Customize Your Color and Seat:


Side Plate Options

Storage Options/Rear Saddle

Surf/Snowboard and Skateboard Support Options

 


THE SMART OLD-STYLE


Based on the Japanese Brat Style and Café Racers models, we gave birth to the SMART OLD-STYLE and the SMART CLASSIC, respectively. Both of these models have a streamlined, cleaner look. Non-essential parts are purposely stripped away, giving the rider a powerful, yet minimal appearance.

This union of styles and simplicity, give the SMART OLD-STYLE a unique presence that has been gathering great recognition from fans all over the world. The unique rider's stance is easily identifiable due to the lower handlebar placement. Your friends won't miss you driving this amazing machine.




Customize Your Color and Seat:

Storage Options/Rear Saddle

 


THE SMART CLASSIC


More than just a motorcycle type, Cafe Racers represented a deep, counterculture movement. Here's our definition: a Cafe Racer is a motorcycle that follows a cultural specification, based on unique criteria from this time period.

This movement was spawned with by young Brits who raced on English roads in the 1950s and 1960s (as a form of escape from the everyday life, with a focus on fun). The starting and ending points of rides were the actual cafes themselves, which became frontier eateries used for meeting up between journeys.

These motorcycles were tailored for higher speeds within short distances, while the dress code for these rock-n-roller riders was leather jackets with patches. These motorcycles had a design pattern: they were lightweight, had short handlebars and a large fuel tank in front of the seat, giving it a utilitarian spirit, arching the rider into a racing stance. The difference in Cafe Racers was all about performance. 


Customize Your Color and Seat:


 

Storage Options/Rear Saddle

 

Put the Power into Your Hands

Push starting was never easier. By placing the button right above the tank, you're given instant access to reliable power.


Standard Speedometer and Push Start

With a clear digital readout a and beautiful blue face, your speedometer will keep you very well informed. We worked diligently to ensure all of these parts would look good together.


Smart Key & App

Your motorcycle will be equipped with features that leverage your smartphone's ease of use. Below are the features listed that come with our App.

  1. Lock/Unlock via Bluetooth
  2. Tamper notification (within 50 meters / line-of-sight)
  3. Proximity access to Unlock (senses your phone so you can ride instantly)
  4. Anti-theft mode: Stops all operation
  5. Notifies you if the motorcycle's battery drops below 50%
     


The Perfect Motor

You will experience very low maintenance performance based on our excellent motor.


 

And the Battery to Go with it

This powerful battery from LG will give you years of reliable service.

Double Your Range

Adding another battery doubles how far you can go. 


Why Spend Double and Wait for Customization?

Don't spend over $10,000 buying a gas motorcycle and converting it into a Scrambler. When you include all of the time, custom work and freight you're adding on thousands. We've already done the work for you. A FLY FREE SMART DESERT with accessories will cost half of what a comparable gasoline-powered motorcycle will, and that doesn't even include the gas savings over time!

 

USB Charging for Your SmartPhone

We also furnished a way to keep your smartphone charged. Ask out about our mount as well for even more system feedback.

 

 

 

FLY FREE SMART Customization & Accessories


 



 





Technical Specifications

 

Customization Reward (A)
 

If you additionally purchase The Accessory Kit and an Extra Battery with your Motorcycle, we will gift you with these items:

 

 

Refer-A-Friend Reward (B)

If you're a verified FLY FREE SMART motorcycle owner, and you refer a friend who purchases their own FLY FREE SMART motorcycle, we will gift you with these items:

Plus, you'll get one of the accessory items below - your choice!:

(surf/snowboard support or skateboard support above)

 


The EV/motorcycle Worlds are Talking

 

 

Always Iterating. Always Testing.

It's not unusual to find the team testing the FLY FREE SMART series in different environments, terrain, and urban areas. The team put a lot of effort into ensuring how feasible the FLY FREE SMART series would be in many different instances, and the effects show.


 

Our Target is Clear. Ready to Ride?

With hundreds of hours of sourcing, prototyping, and assembly under our belt, we've ridden a long way. To get production into full swing we have set a goal of $50,000 for our journey to really begin. Our plan is to keep innovating and exposing a new generation of riders to electric motorcycle riding.

Get up to 35% off of the retail price by helping this dream come true while gaining access to cost-saving, premium perks as well.

The FLY FREE Family


We are designers, engineers, business leaders - but above all we are riders.

Our wonderful team (the FLY FREE Family) is already hard at work making the product better on a daily basis. These talented people are committed to our cause and are fundamental to the development of our products. They are responsible for the future of our company. With your help, we'll build a new product development lab for testing new designs and components, in order to improve our next generation of the FLY FREE SMART series. We've woven strong customer service into our culture and will be training our support team to handle your demands, future challenges and feature requests.

Production Facility

We're targeting China to source our manufacturing and parts as it has made great strides over the last few decades, becoming one of the best-developed countries for transportation needs. China has recently become known for delivering premium components to Europe and North America (for luxury brands you have definitely heard of), with over 200 companies and 18 countries competing for business. This area understands that its mainstay of growth depends on innovation, development, and quality.

 

Warranty

All of our FLY FREE SMART series motorcycles and batteries come with a 1-year limited/6,000 mile (whichever comes first) manufacturer's warranty. If you discover a manufacturer’s (or production related) defect within this timeframe, we will take strong measures to correct our errors (within our warranty rules). Many components will wear down naturally due to normal motorcycle use and riding. Items that are not covered, due to their natural degradation for scheduled replacement are: tires, disc breaks, brake-pads and chain. For a more detailed list, please contact us for more information at info@flyfreesmart.com.

 

Shipping Costs

The team is actively accessing the cost of shipping at this time and attempting to come up with estimates that will be announced as soon as we l have more data. We promise to keep our shipping costs competitive with market rates once we are able to fulfill orders.
 

Going Green

China's factories and power plants have now been regulated to reducing emissions, as the country has recognized economic risks related to a poor environment. They are working on making corrections in a timely manner. Here are the steps their factories have begun taking:

  1. Reducing Coal Usage (cleaner air)
  2. Regulations administered by a consolidated Ministry (for water and ocean issues)
  3. Funding our Future (billions in the decades to come)
  4. BRI (the Belt and Road Initiative) - this is a project that helps connect interconnected countries upgrade roads and highways for easier trade
  5. Sustainability - technology companies are creating alliances to track the environment and find active ways to reduce carbon's presence


Fly Free's Contribution

We are pledging to donate 4% of net profits to a (yet to be selected) non-profit that will focus on cleaner air and water. Both Dhiego and Isac have spent years outdoor doing activities and intimately know the beauty and fragility of our planet. They have spent time in nature and in the ocean, and along with the beauty they have witnessed, they have also seen the negative effects of the rapid industrialization of maturing nations. Why don't you join them in an effort to make the world better, by modifying your core mode of transportation? Who said going green couldn't be fun?
 

Risks & Challenges

We've designed the FLY FREE SMART series to minimize risk. Our frame is simple to make and in addition, we'll use proven components and parts. This gives us a large pool of manufactures to choose from. Coupled with our team's background in motorcycles, product design and engineering gives us great confidence in delivering within our timeline. 

We know how important communication is and we promise to be open and transparent with you to the best of our abilities. We commit to resolving issues as rapidly as is feasible given the circumstances and resources available. We need your help to grow the project and fulfill our mission of helping deliver the most stylish electric motorcycles out there, and we are incredibly appreciative and humbled by your support.

We've already begun working on:

  • Traveling overseas to ensure all parts, fittings, and mechanisms are built to our high standards for motorcycle safety and riding
  • We've starting sourcing a new distribution warehouse the United States
     

Want to Share Our Message with Your Friends?

Feel free to use the Indiegogo Social Media tools to help us spread the word, we'd greatly appreciate it! 
 

Contact Us or Learn More

Feel free to email us at info@flyfreesmart.com or visit our website at http://flyfreesmart.com.

story:
Connect with us: 


visiobike.com               Facebook                 Twitter





"Fashion changes, but style endures."
                                            Coco Chanel

We wanted Visiobike to blend futurism and elegance. So we designed our signature frame that contains and hides the electronics and drivetrain. The motor and battery are artfully integrated under the naked carbon fiber skin. 

We've been developing Visiobike for 2 years, and now it's ready. Biking has evolved! You'll be amazed at the power and sophistication we've integrated into a gorgeous, top quality, user-friendly package. It's still a bike, but a bike that gives you so much more...

And to give you a familiar, intuitive interface to all our technical innovations, we made the Visiobike app, where you control everything.


"Any sufficiently advanced technology is indistinguishable from magic"
                                                                Arthur C. Clarke

To link all Visiobike's e-components with your smartphone, it has a custom layer of hardware and software that interfaces with everything; the electric motor, battery, camera, automatic gear system, and GPS/GSM chip are all connected to Visiobike’s in-house chipset. The Visiobike app controls them and receives data via Bluetooth, and displays all the useful information you need.

We iterated our custom electronics board many times to make it future-proof. Using dual mode Bluetooth 2.3 & 4.0 ensures that Visiobike is compatible with virtually every smartphone, now and in future. What's more, we’ll be continuously updating Visiobike’s firmware, with upgrades transmitted OTA (Over The Air), so expect even better performance as time goes by... 

All this technology, yet your Visiobike experience is as simple as possible! That's smart use of your phone.

“Realize that everything connects to everything else.”
                                                                  Leonardo da Vinci

Your phone shares its intelligence with your Visiobike. Connect via Bluetooth and an amazing synergy happens: after you enter your unlock code, the app and Visiobike work together, giving you functionality that you won’t find anywhere else outside of a new high-end car.

Run the app, and your phone is Visiobike's dashboard! All the controls and useful ride information you need are right there, firmly docked to the handlebars in front of you.

The main screen shows a large, clear speedometer, pedal-assist level selector, battery status, odometer, trip distance, lights control and the lock button.

Swipe left for navigation powered by Google maps or Apple maps. Handy whether you're checking traffic on your commute or out exploring...

Swipe right for our unique Visiocam rearview screen. Yes, Visiobike has a rear-facing camera under the seat - see behind you on your phone screen! No more risking a swerve or wobble to see behind you. No more blindspot: riding feels so much safer when Visiobike’s got your back :)

The GSM/GPS module allows you to keep track of your Visiobike in real time through the app. This is only one of Visiobike's built-in anti theft measures. Great for your peace of mind. Also great if you can't remember where you parked!

All your Visiobike data are saved in the cloud - you can check your ride statistics anytime on your mobile or desktop. And in the settings menu you can adjust and tweak a whole load of options for your Visiobike.

Check out the demo video of the app in the gallery... 

For iOS and Android!                                                                      Don't text and ride!



Any vehicle you ride in traffic should be as safe as possible, right? Not everywhere has bike lanes (yet), and the street can be dangerous, or at least stressful for cyclists. So over and above the bell, we’ve given Visiobike a much praised suite of safety features that you won’t find on any other bike. 


Will your bike still be where you left it when you get back? That worry can ruin your day. Not with Visiobike!

Calling it unstealable might be tempting fate, so we call it ‘virtually unstealable and you’d be stupid to try’. See why:

 

So Visiobike is linked to your phone even when you are not riding. You have the luxury to completely forget about your parked Visiobike, safe in the knowledge that it's secure, and that you will be notified and can alert the police if anyone tampers with it.

We're so confident in our anti theft measures that we're giving all our customers one year's free theft insurance (EU only for now, sorry). 


"Don't fight forces, use them."
                         R. Buckminster Fuller

Carbon fiber is such a futuristic material, and fantastic to look at. It performs better than steel, looks great, and weighs almost nothing.

Its strength allowed us to build Visiobike in its signature shape, eliminating the seat tube and packing a huge 50 cell battery, while keeping weight down. 


"The less effort, the faster and more powerful you will be."
                                                                                       Bruce Lee

Visiobike is what's called a 'pedelec', meaning it has a hybrid drivetrain: the motor assists YOU by multiplying your pedal power. We wanted to keep the rider in the equation - after all, that's what cycling is all about, right?

The difference with Visiobike is... more power! Feel it throughout your ride: the acceleration is dramatic, cruising is fast, and you really can practically ignore hills and headwinds. The motor support is always available - you simply choose how much you want or need. Our electronics monitor cadence, torque and speed to match you and supplement your effort. Visiobike senses how you want to ride and smoothly adds its power in harmony with you. What you put into cycling, Visiobike gives you back with interest.

How does it feel? Simply awesome!

We've noticed that our riders tend to grin a lot, that's the effect: on Visiobike, you feel like a superhuman riding a regular bike.

Both of our motor options will surprise and delight you for sure.

Choose the 250 Watt motor, and effortlessly get up to 25km/h (16 mph). It takes the grunt out of winds and hills and leaves you exhilarated and sweat free wherever you arrive.

The 500 Watt motor goes up to 45 km/h (28 mph). With that much power, Visiobike is a serious beast and even more fun! In the EU, insurance, licence and number plate are required to operate 500 Watt ebikes. We strongly advise you to ride it with great care!


Bringing you breakthrough gear technology:

GEARS 2.0 - NuVinci N360 is a continuously variable gearbox that offers smooth, seamless shifting with no steps through an infinite number of effective gear ratios from low to high within its wide 360% ratio range. It is virtually maintenance free and shifts even at a stop and under high pedal force which makes it the best possible option for electric bicycles!

GEARS 3.0 - NuVinci Harmony adds a small servo motor (the black box in the right pic) that shifts gears automatically every 10 milliseconds. It's controlled by Visiobike's electronics which monitor how you pedal, what's your speed, are you going uphill or downhill to determine the best possible gear ratio at every moment. The end result is velvet smoothness and a hassle free and fun ride!

We made this happen thanks to the great relationship with Fallbrook Technologies, inventors of NuVinci. Here's what they say:  

„We have made the Harmony source code available to the Visiobike development team, and we are happy to see that Visiobike is the first electric bicycle which no longer needs a shifter.“

It's great when such synergy results in such an amazing experience :)


"I don't think there's any thrill that can go through the human heart like that felt by the inventor as he sees some creation of the brain unfolding to success."
                                                                                                   Nikola Tesla

For our first prototype we used sika, a great prototyping material used in the automotive industry, but it’s only good for a few frames. When Visiobike Mk1 came out of that block of sika you can imagine how excited we were!

The prototype showed us where and how we needed to revise the design. Turned out we were pretty close first time round. We tweaked some cosmetic aspects and constructed a whole new dropout.

After a two months of heavy ride-testing, we went back to drawing board.

Confident with the redesign, we were ready to go the hard, expensive route, and make an aluminium mold. The quality of products made from carbon fiber is directly related to the quality and precision of the mold, and aluminium molds are the best. 

To make it, we took a 350kg (around 770 pounds) chunk of aluminium, and a REALLY big CNC machine, and carved out a perfect negative of Visiobike’s form. We polished it beyond perfection and put it to the test. 


The result: immaculate, eye-catching carbon fiber frames!


"The future is already here - it's just not very evenly distributed"
                                                                                        William Gibson

Every time you choose cycling over driving you’re reducing congestion, noise and pollution in your local environment, and you're staying fit. Choosing Visiobike over a car gives you the best of both worlds: wind in your hair and power to go further, faster. You're buying into the future of urban transport. 

In the future, the car is no longer king of our cities. We will reclaim the pavement for the people and cities will be humane and pleasant again.

(source: Foster + Partners)

Projects like Skycycle, by Foster + Partners in London (above) are how we wish to see city infrastructure evolving. This process has already started. You only have to look at Holland or Denmark to get a sense of the future of urban personal transport.

We are all part of the trend, but with Visiobike you're ahead of the curve.










As with every hardware product, there are potential problems on the way from concept to finished, delivered product. We have overcome many of these already and have plans to mitigate unexpected contingencies. Development is complete. The money we need to raise is to certify Visiobike, place bulk orders for parts,  and finalise the assembly process.  Shipping scheduled to start for the first 20 Visiobikes is by the end of August. All other Visiobikes will be delivered in order in which they are pledged for.

So far, we have developed fantastic relationships with our partners and top quality component manufacturers. Everything is ready for Visiobike to go through the certification process, and for us to place bulk orders. All we're missing to go to production is a little bit of your help!

story:
Motion Boards give you the best offers in the market! During design process of the boards, we were focused on three main characteristics: performance, safety and price. In terms of performance, we believe, we reached an optimal combination. Why is it an “optimal combination”? Well, K11’s maximum speed is 36 km/h, which makes it fast, yet safe for riding. Safety first!

Also K11 can go as far as 22 km. The range depends on battery capacity, and battery is the heaviest part of the board. Increasing the range would make K11 too heavy.

In terms of the price, our offer is 50% cheaper comparing to the market average. Why? Well, we’ve made a cool product and we want to share and to let everyone to experience it! Also, our entire international team is located in China, world’s leading manufacturer. This has a positive impact on our manufacturing processes in terms of reduced costs, increased speed and better quality.

 

 

 

Motion K11 is one of the most powerful electric longboards in the world. How is it different from other brands? First of all, our board has advanced performance characteristics, yet its price is significantly lower than those of other brands (50% less on average). With K11 you can have endless rides around your city, conquer the hills and commute in a fast&fun way.

Secondly, K11 is elastic….yeah, it’s possible! We designed a battery that bends with the board. This gives you a better control over your board and more pleasant rides. Finally, it’s the first board designed specifically for the urban use! K11 gives you an ultimate ability to explore your city in a new, amazing way!

 

 

M2 is the best electric shortboard in the world! We are not afraid to claim that because we have a good reason. M2 has two hub motors located inside the wheels and the battery planted inside the deck. So it almost looks like a conventional skateboard (a little bit thicker though), and gives you a 100% control over your ride. With M2 you can turn 360 degrees and even do tricks! 

On top of that its performance is incredible for a shortboard. 20 km range and 33 km/h maximum speed put M2 in one line with longboards. And in many cases this comparison will be in favour of M2. Being a powerful “machine” it is still small and portable. You can take M2 inside the buildings, for work or lectures and it will never be a burden!

 

MOTION M2 Hub motors are implemented inside the wheels! It makes your ride smoother and, at the same time, allows you to use it as a traditional skateboard. Metal core inside the wheel prevents motors from overheating what increases its useful life. M2's Hub motors imply no limits on your ride, giving you the best skating experience!

 

 

 

5 FACTS ABOUT US:

  • We are the best example of multicultural team as we come from 4 different countries.
  • We live and work in Shanghai, China
  • We used Motion Boards samples on daily basis for the last three months
  • We believe we reached optimal solutions in terms of characteristics
  • We believe that we can make your life more convenient and fun

 

Our main goal is to combine top performance and affordability, which is not always an easy task. An idea of delivering more for less raised some major challenges throughout the project. We have analysed tens of factories around China to find unique parts, which would meet our quality and price requirements. After months of analysing and testing, we can assure the best quality of both K11 and M2. We have finally determined the most reliable suppliers on the market, who now deliver us excellent parts. At the same time, this approach allows us to keep the price low without cheating on quality. Therefore, we believe that our hard work paid off and we have overcome our biggest challenge successfully.

 

We can ship to any country or region. However, some countries/regions have restrictions on imports of goods, which contain batteries. This may cause the shipping cost to be unreasonably high. Please, contact us directly to check the shipping cost for your country/region.

Your boards will be shipped within approximately 45 days after the end of the campaign.

 

Support us on Instagram, Facebook, YouTube and Twitter. If you like what we do, share our page with your friends/followers, leave comments and spread the word. We have created an amazing product for you and we need your support. Thank you!

 

Q: Why are your boards cheaper than those of other brands?

A: When designing our boards we emphasised two criteria: performance and affordability. Having high performance characteristics our products cost you twice less on average. There are many reasons for that, however, the most significant one is that our entire team is located in Shanghai China what allows for better productivity, better access to various components and reduced labour costs.

 

Q: Does the reduced price implies reduced quality?

A: This is not the case! Our engineers perform comprehensive quality control; therefore, we are fully confident about our products reliability and performance characteristics delivered.

 

Q: How long does it take to produce the eBoards?

A: We will start production straight after the campaign will be finished. Depending on the scale production will take from 1 to 2 months. Your boards will be shipped immediately after the quality controlling procedures.

 

Q: What are the package dimensions and weight?

A: K11: 1020mm*330mm*170mm; weight of package = 10kg. M2: 725mm*300mm*185mm, weight of package =9.5kg. 

 

Q: What is the shipping price?

A: We ship globally! The cost of shipping is $89 to any location.

 

Q: Which model suits me more?

A: If you want to experience top performance with high speed and long mileage we would recommend you to purchase K11. If you want a portable, light and convenient board, then M2 will suit you more.

 

Q: Can I ride my board in the rain?

A: Our batteries are waterproof. However, if it is a heavy rain there is still a possibility that the battery could be damaged. Therefore, we do not recommend to use your board when it is raining heavily or test its impermeability by throwing it into the water.

 

Q: Do you provide a warranty?

A: Yes! Every backer is guaranteed a six-month warranty.

 

Q: Is it easy to learn how to ride?

A: It is! If you had bad skateboarding experience before, don’t worry! It is different from a regular skateboard. After one-two weeks of practising you will feel 100% comfortable riding you Motion board.

 

Q: What if it runs out of battery on the middle of the road?

A: Not a problem! You are still able to ride it as a regular skateboard.

 

Q. Is safety equipment required?

A: Depends on your skills! If you are confident in your abilities, you can go without it. However, we recommend you to use some safety gear (e.g. helmet), especially if you are a beginner.

 

Q. How long does the battery live?

A: 1000 cycles of charging and discharging.

 

Q. Do you have special offers for resellers and distributors?

A: If you want to order 10+ sets, send us your request via email smm@get-motion.com. We will provide you with reseller offers.

 

Q. What will be the price after the campaign?

A: K11: $800  M2: $600

 

Q. How can I contact you if I have further questions?

A: You can reach us via email: smm@get-motion.com

However, some countries/regions have restrictions on imports of goods, which contain batteries. This may cause the shipping cost to be unreasonably high. Please, contact us directly to check the shipping cost for your country/region.Your boards will be shipped within approximately 45 days after the end of the campaign. Support us on Instagram, Facebook, YouTube and Twitter. If you like what we do, share our page with your friends/followers, leave comments and spread the word. We have created an amazing product for you and we need your support. Thank you! Q: Why are your boards cheaper than those of other brands?A: When designing our boards we emphasised two criteria: performance and affordability. Having high performance characteristics our products cost you twice less on average. There are many reasons for that, however, the most significant one is that our entire team is located in Shanghai China what allows for better productivity, better access to various components and reduced labour costs. Q: Does the reduced price implies reduced quality?A: This is not the case! Our engineers perform comprehensive quality control; therefore, we are fully confident about our products reliability and performance characteristics delivered. Q: How long does it take to produce the eBoards?A: We will start production straight after the campaign will be finished. Depending on the scale production will take from 1 to 2 months. Your boards will be shipped immediately after the quality controlling procedures. Q: What are the package dimensions and weight?A: K11: 1020mm*330mm*170mm; weight of package = 10kg. M2: 725mm*300mm*185mm, weight of package =9.5kg.  Q: What is the shipping price?A: We ship globally! The cost of shipping is $89 to any location. Q: Which model suits me more?A: If you want to experience top performance with high speed and long mileage we would recommend you to purchase K11. If you want a portable, light and convenient board, then M2 will suit you more. Q: Can I ride my board in the rain?A: Our batteries are waterproof. However, if it is a heavy rain there is still a possibility that the battery could be damaged. Therefore, we do not recommend to use your board when it is raining heavily or test its impermeability by throwing it into the water. Q: Do you provide a warranty?A: Yes! Every backer is guaranteed a six-month warranty. Q: Is it easy to learn how to ride?A: It is! If you had bad skateboarding experience before, don’t worry! It is different from a regular skateboard. After one-two weeks of practising you will feel 100% comfortable riding you Motion board. Q: What if it runs out of battery on the middle of the road?A: Not a problem! You are still able to ride it as a regular skateboard. Q. Is safety equipment required?A: Depends on your skills! If you are confident in your abilities, you can go without it. However, we recommend you to use some safety gear (e.g. helmet), especially if you are a beginner. Q. How long does the battery live?A: 1000 cycles of charging and discharging. Q. Do you have special offers for resellers and distributors?A: If you want to order 10+ sets, send us your request via email smm@get-motion.com. We will provide you with reseller offers. Q. What will be the price after the campaign?A: K11: $800  M2: $600 Q. How can I contact you if I have further questions?A: You can reach us via email: smm@get-motion.com

story:
You Buy. We Fly.

This is TapIt's motto because we believe in keeping drunk driving off the roads. Log into our mobile application, purchase the beverage of your choice, and we will save you from endangering others' lives in LESS than ONE HOUR.

About Us

TapIt is a delivery service available to prevent those who are intoxicated from driving on the roads and threatening other peoples' lives just to get another 6-pack of Coors Light. We believe that it is crucial to keep intoxicated people off the roads but still allow for some fun that night. This is why our service will be beneficial for those 21 years or older.

  • My name is Russell Lowry and I am the Owner and Chief Technology Officer at TapIt LLC.
  • I am a Freshman Computer Science major at the University of Arkansas.
  • I'm very familiar with alcohol laws and have been working with legislation in many different states to provide this service to each and every one of you.

Coming Soon (will be updated)

We do not guarantee delivery to your state but we will try our hardest!
Is your state not listed? You can still benefit from our perks! Read below in "What We Need & What You Get".
  • Arizona
    •
  • Arkansas
    •
  • California
    •
  • Colorado
    •
  • Florida
    •
  • Louisiana
    •
  • New York
    •
  • Oregon
    •
  • Texas
    •
LEGEND
Cleared for service
In contact with legislation

What We Need & What You Get

  • To lift TapIt off the ground, we need $50,000 in funding. We want to provide TapIt office space for our employees as well as customer get-togethers every now and then. We also want our drivers to have eco-friendly company cars provided by our fundings.
  • We need top of the line ID verification software.
  • Best of all, we provide our backers with fun prizes and perks. Depending on how much you help us out, perks range from stacks of TapIt logo coasters and coozies as far as personal invites for YOU plus ONE to one of our TapIt offices located nearest to you. Personal invites involve free catered food and drinks for all.
  • If we do not reach our goal, all funds will be refunded to all of our backers. We appreciate any and all help as we would love to help change the world.

What Market Will Be First?

Not every state in the United States will allow our delivery service, but we want everyones support. We have added a voting poll to our Facebook page with the markets we are currently cleared for. You can also click HERE to vote on the poll. The state with the highest vote by the end of the campaign (May 11th) will be the first market for TapIt.

The Impact

Last year, nearly 10,000 people were killed in drunk driving accidents. Although this may seem like a small percentage of the American population, these are 100% preventable deaths that we can eradicate. We want to help put a stop to drunk driving and underage drinking.

*We donate 2% of our profits to Responsibility.org

story:
Overview

We've designed Arsenal to be aerodynamic, durable, and light. It is the all-around solution for any cyclist. You can get a complete system or choose exactly which wheel setup you'd prefer with our a la carte pricing option.

Why Arsenal?

As competitive cyclists and triathletes, we’re always looking for an edge. Aerodynamic wheels provide that edge, but not without a few key drawbacks. First and foremost, there isn’t one set of aero wheels that is perfect for all conditions. So if you want to be at your best, you need to own a few sets of wheels. You need a lightweight shallow set for climbing, you need a medium depth set for windy days, and you need a super deep set for calm, flat days. And if you’re really serious about your racing, you need a disc wheel as well. But a fleet of wheels like that will cost you five to ten thousand dollars, which is absolutely insane.

What is Arsenal?

Arsenal is a modular system that combines the versatility of a fleet of wheels with the cost and convenience of a single wheelset. The heart of Arsenal is the interchangeable Aero Shells. These Aero Shells, which resemble the aerodynamic portion of a traditional aero wheel, feature a magnetic attachment mechanism. This mechanism allows a rider to simply snap the shells onto a shallow-rimmed climbing wheel and instantly convert it to an aerodynamic race wheel.  

Arsenal will be sold as a complete system, which will include:

  • a set of lightweight aluminum climbing wheels
  • a set of 60mm Aero Shells for windy days (front and rear)
  • a set of 90mm Aero Shells for calm days (front and rear)
  • a carbon fiber wheel cover for ultimate aerodynamic performance (rear)


Specifications

The climbing wheel, which serves as the base wheel for the Aero Shells, will come specced with DT Swiss 240s hubs, a high-end welded aluminum rim, and Sapim CX-Ray spokes. This puts the weight at a feathery 1420g without skewers. More importantly, the reliability of DT Swiss hubs, CX-Ray spokes, and a high-quality aluminum rim will ensure high performance for years to come. Furthermore, the braking performance of aluminum will ensure this set of wheels can be used every single day without fear of losing braking power on a rainy day.

Weight

  • Base climbing wheelset: 1420g (w/o skewers)
  • Wheelset weight w/ 60mm Aero Shells: 1680g (w/o skewers)
  • Wheelset weight w/ 90mm Aero Shells: 1780g (w/o skewers)
  • Rear wheel w/ disc cover weight: 950g (w/o skewers)

For comparison's sake, our 90mm wheels are within 20 grams of the shallower Zipp 808 Firecrest, and our disc wheel is nearly 150 grams lighter than a Zipp Super-9 Carbon Clincher Disc.


Aerodynamics

Modern CFD software paired with high performance cloud computing has allowed us to quickly iterate through hundreds of designs for our Aero Shells. The 60mm Aero Shells have been optimized for the higher yaw angles a rider will see on a windy day, while the 90mm shells have been optimized for the lower yaw angles a rider will see on a calm day. This optimization was based heavily on our research into yaw angles, which showed that yaw angles are much lower than the industry generally assumes.

Lower yaw angles mean that frontal area is an important factor in the overall aerodynamics of the wheel. With that in mind, we've decided to avoid jumping on the "wider is better" bandwagon. Instead, we've chosen a medium width rim, measuring in at 23.5mm at the brake track. The ideal tire width for this rim is around 23mm, which gives a good balance between aerodynamics, rolling resistance, and comfort.

The graph above shows wind tunnel results of our 60mm Aero Shells compared to one of our competitor's 62mm wheels. The test was done at the A2 wind tunnel. The wheels were tested on a bike with everything but the front wheel held constant. The Arsenal was tested with a Bontrager R4 Aero 22mm tire, and the Strike was tested with a Continental GP4000S 23mm tire. We chose to use a slightly wider tire on the Strike to complement its wider 25mm rim width.

Aerodynamic Research

Yaw Angle Research


Magnetic Attachment Mechanism

The interchangeable Aero Shells attach to the base wheel magnetically. Each Aero Shell half features ten magnets. When the shells are placed on the base wheel, the magnets line up and the shells snap together. The beauty of this magnetic attachment system is that it takes a sustained lateral force, such as that provided by a rider's hands, to pull the shells apart. Bumps in the road only provide a vertical force, which has no impact on the shells. This means that the Aero Shells can be quickly and easily taken on and off, yet stay securely attached to the wheel while riding.



Manufacturing

Deciding on a manufacturer for the carbon fiber Aero Shells was an extensive process. In the end, we chose Wolf Composite Solutions, based out of Columbus, Ohio. We chose them for a few key reasons. The first and most important reason is that they make incredibly high quality parts. We know firsthand how difficult it is to make flawless carbon fiber parts, so when we toured their facility (AKA "the Wolfden") and saw nothing but perfectly finished parts, we knew we had found someone special. The second reason we chose them is because of their experience with the automotive industry. In terms of the size and the annual volume of the parts, carbon fiber parts for cars are very similar to carbon fiber parts for bikes. Both industries require high-performance parts produced in high volume (as opposed to the aerospace industry that needs much lower volumes).

Each mold for our Aero Shells starts out as a solid block of aluminum. A large CNC milling machine then cuts into the metal, transforming it to the exact shape specified by our CAD drawings. 

A set of molds consists of a mold for the left side and a mold for the right side. Currently, we have one set of molds for the 60mm shells. Following the campaign we will have Wolf make a set of molds for the 90mm shells. Each set of molds can make one pair (i.e. a left side and a right side) of Aero Shells a day. So making a front and rear set takes two days. That means that with one set of molds we can produce ten complete sets of Arsenal Aero Shells per month. If we surpass our goal by a wide margin then we will invest in additional sets of molds so we can produce the shells fast enough to deliver them by the estimated delivery dates. 

The adapter pieces that the magnets sit inside of will be 3D printed in a durable black plastic. We had initially planned on using injection molding for this part, but the slight cost savings are not enough to justify the sky-high tooling costs. Furthermore, since the production pieces will be exactly the same as the pieces we're already using, we know there won't be any surprises when we switch into full-scale production.

The magnets we are using are N52 grade Neodymium magnets. They provide an exceptional pulling force of 3 pounds each, while weighing less than a gram a piece. The magnets attach to the adapter pieces with an adhesive that is rated to withstand tension forces in excess of 3000 psi. This is around 100 times more than is necessary, but it's better to err on the safe side.


PowerTap Upgrade

One of the main benefits of Arsenal is that it gives you the ability to train with a power meter no matter what wheel setup you choose to ride for the day. That's why we're offering a PowerTap GS upgrade option, which we highly recommend. The GS retails for $839, but we'll upgrade your Arsenal rear hub to the GS for $500. To choose this option, just add $500 to your contribution amount

Perks


Complete Systems

For those who like the simplicity of a pre-configured system, or for those who just want it all, we offer the complete Arsenal Wheel System at a discount from the a la carte option. Backers of our campaign can get their Arsenal Wheel Systems for as low as $1599. There will only be 10 sets at this price, though. If you're not one of the first ten backers, there will be 20 sets at $1799. 

A La Carte

We will also be offering up to 70 sets in an a la carte fashion. The base price of $699 covers the base climbing wheels. Then you can add as few or as many Aero Shells as you like. You can also upgrade to a PowerTap GS rear hub. The pricing for the Aero Shells and PowerTap upgrade is as follows:

  • 60mm front Aero Shell - $250
  • 60mm rear Aero Shell - $250
  • 90mm front Aero Shell - $250
  • 90mm rear Aero Shell - $250
  • Disc Cover (rear wheel only) - $200

  • PowerTap upgrade - $500


We will be limiting our campaign to 100 sets to ensure we can provide the utmost in customer service to our backers and to ensure timely delivery. 



About Us

Catalyst was founded in 2013 by three passionate cyclists: Zach McCormick, Nick McCormick, and Justin Clark. Arsenal is the third product we have released. The first two, our carbon fiber wheel covers and our Hydra BTA water bottle cage, have been well received by the triathlon community, and are used by over a dozen professional triathletes. Arsenal is the culmination of everything we've learned over these past few years, and represents our ambition to become a major player in the cycling industry.

Zach McCormick, CEO

  

Zach is a mountain biker, triathlete, and occasional road cyclist. He handles product design and strategy for Catalyst.

Justin Clark, CMO

Justin has been a triathlete since his early years of high school. Plagued by injuries for the last two years, he has used all his free time to become our marketing genius.

Nick McCormick, CTO

Nick is an aspiring professional triathlete who also happens to be a pretty darn good engineer.

story:
We want to challenge the bicycle industry. We do so by truly innovating the way a bicycle frame is produced. A new production process designed with one thing in mind: bring bicycle production back to the Netherlands.

The manufacturing of bicycle frames hasn't changed much in the last 100 years. To this day, the welding involved is still done by hand. We set out to change that. 

Our innovative production process brings bicycle production in to the 21st century and back to the Netherlands. The highly automated process uses state of the art production techniques commonly used in the car industry . 

Producing in the Netherlands means that we can closely monitor every step of the manufacturing process, leaving no room for error.

We assemble the best products available. Mokumono uses a grease-free belt drive, hydraulic disk brakes and worry-free anti-puncture tires.

With Mokumono we focus on creating bicycles designed for the modern urban cyclist, fast, light and durable. 


The design of our frame is the outcome of renewing the way bicycle frames are produced. Mokumono frames are made of two sheets of 7000-grade aluminum pressed into form and laser welded together.
The production techniques are reflected in the design of the frame. The edge on the outline of the frame visually splits it in half and reflects the way it is put together.


Aluminium is a strong and lightweight material but aluminium bicycles are often classified as a rough ride because of its stiffness. To allow some flexing for a more comfortable ride we designed the frame with cantilever rear stays instead of the traditional triangle shape. Making sure that our strong and lightweight frame offers a smooth ride.


Fender and rack mounts are part every frame to make sure that you can ride your Mokumono through puddles without getting wet. Fenders will come as an option to be purchased after the campaign. 


The internal brake cable routing hides the brake cables from view but more importantly from the environment. With the cables inside the frame they are less susceptible to damages and therefore have a longer life span.

Our choices of components reflect a selection of the best products available. For us that means a combination of usability and durability. We are looking for components that are comfortable and low in maintenance. All components of Mokumono must have a long life span and offer exceptional performance in all weather conditions.

The Gates Carbon Belt Drive System is designed to be a stronger, quieter alternative to the traditional bike chain. The durable carbon-fiber belt is grease-free and requires little to no maintenance. It won’t leave any marks on your pants and you’ll never have to pull over to fix a dropped chain.


The Shimano 105 grade hydraulic flat mount road disk brakes bring high performance stopping power. These brakes use a mineral oil reservoir housed in a compact and ergonomic mechanical lever. Heat dispersing pads combined with Shimano’s ICE technology rotors allow for consistent braking performance through all weather conditions.


The Brooks Cambium C17 saddle is made from vulcanized natural rubber and organic cotton top that offers extraordinary comfort and exceptional freedom of movement, The hard-wearing top, die-cast aluminum structure, and tubular steel rails allow the Cambium to stand up to many years of hard use. Furthermore, a distinct dampening effect is delivered by the classic Brooks “hammock” construction, reducing road vibrations and keeping the rider comfortably in the saddle.


The 32mm wide Continental Grand Prix 4season are robust all-season tires with worry-free puncture protection optimized for cold and wet weather. They are made in Germany, have great lifespan and are by many considered to be the top of the line all-season road bike tires.


The optional Shimano Alfine 8-speed hub strengths are rapidity, silent shifting and is practically maintenance free. The hub basically replaces an 8-speed cassette in a 12-38-tooth configuration. 


The optional Curana C-lite fenders are made from aluminium and extremely light yet very durable. The fenders will come as an option to be purchased after the campaign. 

Our prototype is white but the Mokumono will be available in four colors: gloss white, matt black, a deep metallic blue and a deep metallic red. All colors come with a gloss black seat tube. 
You will be able to choose your desired color after the campaign.

Frame: Mokumono 7000 grade aluminium monocoque
Front fork: Aluminium TBA
Headset: FSA Orbit
Rims: Ryde Dutch 19
Hubs: Shimano
Brakes: Shimano 105 grade flat mount hydraulic disc brakes
Tires: Continental Grand Prix 4season 32mm
Crank: Shimano Alfine
Drivetrain: Gates CDX Carbon Belt Drive
Pedals: Mokumono
Seat post: TBA
Saddle: Brooks Cambium C17
Handlebar Stem combo: Mokumono
Grips: TBA
Gears: Shimano Alfine 8-speed (optional)
Fenders: Curana C-lite (optional)

Estimated weight: 
Singlespeed: ~9.5kg
8-speed: ~11kg

We designed the frame in a way that it suits riders of different lengths. The frame has a slight slope giving a lower stand over height and a longer head tube for a more comfortable riding position. The Mokumono will be most comfortable for riders around 170 to 190cm (5'7" and 6’3"). To achieve the best fit you can choose between three stem lenghts/stack heights:

You will be able to choose the right size for your Mokumono after the campaign.  

We believe in what we make and therefore warrant our frames are free from defects in material and workmanship for a period of five years for the original retail purchaser. 

Cycling and The Netherlands are synonymous. Almost everybody, even our Prime Minister, uses a bike to get to work, to go shopping, or spend some relaxing hours of leisure time. Cycling has been part of the Dutch culture for centuries.

The first Dutch bicycle factory (Burgers) opened in 1870. At the start of the 19th century, there were more than 30 big bicycle manufactures in The Netherlands, producing 20.000 bicycles per year. It might be hard to imagine, but since then the production of bicycles has hardly changed. Traditionally, a bicycle frame is built by joint welding metal tubes. This is mostly done by hand and therefore labor intensive.

In recent years, all of the big Dutch manufactures have moved their production to cheap labor countries, typically in Southeast Asia, in an attempt to cut costs. That means that in spite of our rich bicycle manufacturing history, bicycles are no longer being produced in The Netherlands.

We believe it is time to reverse those tracks and bring back bicycles production to The Netherlands. Inspired by the way cars are produced, Mokumono frames are made of two sheets of aluminum pressed into form and laser welded together. The European car industry has managed to retain production in several European countries by adapting techniques that lend themselves for automation. By borrowing these techniques, we are able to almost fully automate our production process, significantly lowering labor requirements and thus making it possible to build bicycles in The Netherland again.

The main advantage of producing bicycles in The Netherlands is that it allows us to closely monitor every step of the production process. This means that we can discover and fix potential flaws fast and adequately, making sure that every Mokumono bike is of the highest possible quality.


Over two years ago Mokumono started as the Design Academy Eindhoven graduation project of Bob Schiller under the name Epo. Since the start of the project, three prototypes have been constructed as a result of countless sketches and design iterations. The first two were life-size 3D prints that looked like the real thing but were not strong enough to ride on. The third and final prototype is a fully functional bike. Instead of 3D printing, this prototype is hand-formed out of 7000 grade aluminum, the same material that will be used in the final product. This prototype allows us to test the strength and rigidity of the bike, and to feel how the bike handles.


Next to adjusting and perfecting the design, we have sought and found a very reliable manufacturing partner for the production of our frames. Witte van Moort. 
Witte van Moort is a family business that can look back on more than 60 years experience, and that has now become a leading supplier in the field of sheet-metal working. Every day, more than 200 enthusiastic employees are involved in the fabrication of a wide range of products for various branches of industry in the Netherlands and beyond. Over the years, WVM has continued to innovate and modernise. As a consequence, the company operates an extensive fleet of machinery, and makes use of the latest techniques making it the perfect partner for Mokumono. 


Of course we still have plenty of steps ahead of us before Mokumono is ready for the mass market. An important first step is crowdfunding. Once we meet our crowdfunding goal, we will have the means to commission the construction of the tools necessary to start production and place orders for the necessary parts at our suppliers. We hope to reach this goal so that we will be able to fulfil your pre-orders and reward your support!


All units will be carefully packed and shipped in a custom box with form-fitting high-density foam for maximum protection. All orders will include DHL Post online parcel tracking and insurance. The shipping costs are: The Netherlands: €25 Europe: €50 North America: €150 Rest of world: €200

It is also possible to pick up your Mokumono at our office in Amsterdam, if you decide to do so you will get a full refund of the shipping costs. You will be able to choose this option after the campaign. 

Additional duties/taxes may apply depending on your destination country.


The Mokumono team consists of Bob Schiller and his twin brother Tom Schiller. Bob is Mokumono’s founder and graduate from the Design Academy, Eindhoven. Tom is an Environmental and Resources Management graduate from the Vrije University of Amsterdam. Within the team, Bob is the head of design and Tom is responsible for overseeing the production and supply chain.

The name Mokumono is a composition of two words that express where we are from and what we make. The first part, Mokum, refers to Amsterdam. With more bicycles than inhabitants, it can be rightfully said that Amsterdam is the cycling capital of the world. In other words the ideal home for a new bicycles brand. The second part of the name, Mono, is an abbreviation of the word monocoque and refers to the construction technique of our frames. A monocoque is a structural approach whereby loads are supported through an object’s external skin without internal strengthening.
story_txt:
We want to challenge
the bicycle industry. We do so by truly innovating the way a bicycle
frame is produced. A
new production process designed with one thing in mind: bring bicycle
production back to the Netherlands. 


The manufacturing of bicycle frames hasn't changed much in the last 100 years. To this day, the welding involved is still done by hand. We set out to change that. 
Our innovative production process brings bicycle production in to the 21st
century and back to the Netherlands. The highly automated process uses state of the art production techniques commonly used in the car industry . 
Producing
in the Netherlands means that we can closely monitor every step of the manufacturing
process, leaving no room for error. 
We assemble the best products available. Mokumono
uses a grease-free belt drive,
hydraulic disk brakes and worry-free anti-puncture tires. 


With Mokumono we focus on creating
bicycles designed for the modern urban cyclist, fast, light and durable. 



























The design of our frame is the outcome of renewing the way bicycle frames are produced. Mokumono frames are made of two sheets of 7000-grade aluminum pressed into form and laser welded together.The production techniques are reflected in the design of the frame. The edge on the outline of the frame visually splits it in half and reflects the way it is put together.

Aluminium is a strong and lightweight material but aluminium bicycles are often classified as a rough ride because of its stiffness. To allow some flexing for a more comfortable ride we designed the frame with cantilever rear stays instead of the traditional triangle shape. Making sure that our strong and lightweight frame offers a smooth ride.






Fender and rack mounts are part every frame to make sure that you can ride your Mokumono through puddles without getting wet. Fenders will come as an option to be purchased after the campaign. 






The internal brake cable routing hides the brake cables from view but more importantly from the environment. With the cables inside the frame they are less susceptible to damages and therefore have a longer life span.










Our choices of components reflect a selection of the best products available. For us that means a combination of usability and durability. We are looking for components that are comfortable and low in maintenance. All components of Mokumono must have a long life span and offer exceptional performance in all weather conditions. 
The Gates Carbon Belt Drive System is designed to be a stronger, quieter alternative to the traditional bike chain. The durable carbon-fiber belt is grease-free and requires little to no maintenance. It won’t leave any marks on your pants and you’ll never have to pull over to fix a dropped chain.






The Shimano 105 grade hydraulic flat mount road disk brakes bring high performance stopping power. These brakes use a mineral oil reservoir housed in a compact and ergonomic mechanical lever. Heat dispersing pads combined with Shimano’s ICE technology rotors allow for consistent braking performance through all weather conditions.






The Brooks Cambium C17 saddle is made from vulcanized natural rubber and organic cotton top that offers extraordinary comfort and exceptional freedom of movement, The hard-wearing top, die-cast aluminum structure, and tubular steel rails allow the Cambium to stand up to many years of hard use. Furthermore, a distinct dampening effect is delivered by the classic Brooks “hammock” construction, reducing road vibrations and keeping the rider comfortably in the saddle.






The 32mm wide Continental Grand Prix 4season are robust all-season tires with worry-free puncture protection optimized for cold and wet weather. They are made in Germany, have great lifespan and are by many considered to be the top of the line all-season road bike tires.






The optional Shimano Alfine 8-speed hub strengths are rapidity, silent shifting and is practically maintenance free. The hub basically replaces an 8-speed cassette in a 12-38-tooth configuration. 






The optional Curana C-lite fenders are made from aluminium and extremely light yet very durable. 
The fenders will come as an option to be purchased after the campaign. 










Our prototype is white but the Mokumono will be available in four colors: gloss white, matt black, a deep metallic blue and a deep metallic red. All colors come with a gloss black seat tube. You will be able to choose your desired color after the campaign.

Estimated weight: Singlespeed: ~9.5kg
8-speed: ~11kg

story:
The b’fair e-bike

100% Danish design made in collaboration with award-winning bicycle engineer
Rasmus Gjesing
Cutting-edge features, premium craftsmanship, timeless quality


Among its many features, the b'fair e-bike has a Bafang motor with three speed settings and a retro steel frame for ultimate comfort and speed.  Battery with a built-in power bank and a cargo rack which makes it perfect for both a quick errand run and a long day on the go.

 

 

 

 

Choose your favorite perk and color

Step 1. Choose one of our six cool perks - Do you wanna share 2 e-bikes with 3 of your best friends, buy 10 e-bikes for your company or simply need one for your self? 

Step 2. Choose between Glossy Black, Cherry Red or Indigo Blue

Step 3. Add an extra battery at checkout - a 36V 7AH or the more powerful 36 V 10,5AH

 

 

Specifications on all b'fair e-bikes

 

 


 

An e-bike has many benefits compared to other transportation options; they are low cost, easy to maintain, supports green energy, fun to ride and are a safe and healthy way of living. 

The b’fair e-bike is a unique choice for the future e-bike owner, combining high quality and rich aesthetics with a very special school project in Bangladesh. In this way, the b’fair e-bike is a lifestyle, a choice and an extraordinary journey towards a better future for the children in one of the poorest countries in the world. 

 

 

 

Building a school is hard work -

What you'll help build and what good it'll do

The school will be build in the village of Tulshibaru in the district of Gopalganj. Tulshibaru is located in a less developed and lowland area, which means that most of the land is underwater for approximately 9 months every year, it makes it one of Bangladesh’s most disadvantaged areas. The area is very poor and the population does not have access to proper cultural and educational facilities.

Approximately 5000 people are living in Tulshibaru and its surrounding area, only 40% of the population are literate - able to read and write.

In order to decrease the poverty and illiteracy rates it is crucial that the children in the community get access to a place where they can receive quality education and feel safe no matter the season.

 

The new school in bulletpoints

  • The new school will contain at least 10 rooms; classrooms, a teacher's room, and an admin room. 
  • Each room will be approximately 20 feet wide and 30 feet long.
  • There will be 7 toilets; 3 for girls, 3 for boys and one for school staff.
  • The School will benefit 150-160 students in the area within the age range of 5 to 12-year-olds.
  • 8 teachers will be teaching at the school including the subjects of arts, dance, and music.

 

 

 

Why build a school?

We believe that all children should be able to create the future they dream of having. By providing children with the ability to write, read and basic math skills you give them valuable tools to move forward in life.

Lack of access to quality education is one of the root causes to why poverty is being passed down from generation to generation.

In poor and rural areas schools are the main place where communities learn about hygiene and sanitation practices. By improving hygiene and sanitation reduces the risk of disease spread of diarrhea and other serious diseases tremendously. Additionally, when children no longer are sick from consuming contaminated food or water, they are able to attend school more often and focus on their studies. 

Children are the ones that are mostly impacted by education, and they will take their knowledge and hygiene practices home and teach the rest of their family members. 

 

 

The Backers Wall -

How we celebrate your support

All the children just love to know who have helped building the school for them and their future. Therefore we want to make a 'Backers Wall' at the school. So when purchasing a b’fair e-bike you will also have a “Backers Wall Plate” that will have your name and home country stated. The wall will have a World Map in the middle that way the school children can learn, see and reflect on where around the world people who helped build the school live. If you wish to stay anonymous, please state this at checkout. The wall will look something like this: 



 

 

Our journey 

b'fair group is a bicycle startup company, based on the belief that education is the first step out of poverty and that all children should be able to create the future they dream of.

Our journey began in 2016, where we made our first b'fair bicycle. Every b'fair bike sold have supported one child's schooling for a year. Since we started the company a dream of ours have been to build a quality school in one of the most disadvantaged areas of Bangladesh. And now the time has finally come to introduce the world to the newest member of our b'fair family:                    The b'fair e-bike.
 

 

Back us and share the love

Thank you so much for taking the time to read about our dream project. If you want to support us, do it here on Indiegogo or simply help us spread the word. The easiest way to tell your friends, family and network is to share our posts on social media. For that, we’ll be eternally grateful.

Can I back it without purchasing a b’fair e-bike?

YES, you can! If you like our project then you can always back us with whatever amount you desire - a few euros goes a long way! Simply click the “BACK IT” button on the top of the page and support a great cause.

Follow us and share the love on : 

  • Facebook: @B'fair Group
  • Instagram: @bfairgroup
  • LinkedIn: @b'fair Group  
  • Twitter: @b'fair Group
     


The b'fair team

Our filmcrew in Bangladesh - Filmskuret - Simon, Biva  and Anders.

Caroline on the e-bike

Annie,  Rasmus  and Henrik having a break 

Annie, Claudia, Caroline with Hugo the office dog and Henrik in front of our office in Copenhagen.

Can I back it without purchasing a b’fair e-bike?
YES, you can! If you like our project then you can always back us with whatever amount you desire - a few euros goes a long way! Simply click the “BACK IT” button on the top of the page and support a great cause.
Follow us and share the love on : 

Facebook: @B'fair Group

LinkedIn: @b'fair Group

The b'fair team
